messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2984
messages.msgSnippet: ... Thank you.  I don t care what you call them.  Just please define them more narrowly than Christian , since what it does mean is: a person professing
messages.messageBody:
> There are millions of mean Christian parents who don't even homeschool who
> would consider "the sovereignty of children" to be blasphemous.

Thank you. I don't care what you call them. Just please define them more
narrowly than "Christian", since what it does mean is:

a person professing belief in Jesus as the Christ, or in the religion based
on the teachings of Jesus.
(Webster's New World Dictionary of the American Language, Second College
Ed., p. 253)

> I hope there are also millions who wouldn't.

The REST of us "who wouldn't" are entitled to call our chosen faith
Christian. I refuse to give up that name. Yes, it's a sore topic for me.
But it's one that affects an awful lot of people.

brenda
